humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 3.5 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The tumor has been identified as a poorly differentiated invasive lobular carcinoma, and the T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, ignoring any substaging information. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue. In this pathology report, the tumor diameter is specified as 3.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension. Therefore, based on the information provided in the report, the patient's cancer has a pathologic T stage of T2.
